comments:
Created an attachment (id=77370)
C/C++ General Include path listing not visible...

Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Created a new, empty C++ Makefile project ("--Other Toolchain--" selected as the toolchain)
2. Right clicked newly created C++ project from the C/C++ Projects view and selected Properties...C/C++ General...Paths and symbols
3. Navigate to Include tab in resulting Paths and symbols dialog and nothing appears (see attached screenshot)
4. NOTE: Include paths can be added/deleted from the "list" of include paths - you just cannot see the list itself!


More information:
I believe that the following backtrace is related to the Paths and symbols dialog problem I am seeing:

Greg, 

could you please provide additional information:

- have you tried later Eclipse/CDT builds, for example
     release/20070702/eclipse-cpp-europa-win32.zip ?
- have you tried with newer OS (WinXP, Win2003) ?
- whether the problem occurs every time you open Properties dialog ?
- whether it affects other projects (if any) ?
- whether the similar P&S pages (Symbols, Libraries) behave so ?

Thanks.
(In reply to comment #1)
> Greg, 
> 
> could you please provide additional information:
> 
> - have you tried later Eclipse/CDT builds, for example

> - whether it affects other projects (if any) ?

Oleg,

1.) I just downloaded this build yesterday from the main Eclipse download page link for "Eclipse IDE for C/C++ Developers" here:
http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/technology/epp/downloads/release/20070702/eclipse-cpp-europa-win32.zip&r=1&protocol=http

Just to make sure I am not mistaken, I also redownloaded it 2 minutes ago and this download does in fact correspond to Eclipse Build ID: I20070621-1340, so maybe the link is bad? I also tried to update via the Europa Discovery Site but no newer versions of Eclipse were available via Software Update.

2.) I have not tried on WinXP/Win2003 as I do not currently have a machine available, but I can attempt this later tonight.

3.) The problem occurs every time I open the Properties dialog. I can still Add/Delete Include Path entries, but I cannot see the listing (i.e. the .cproject file does in fact update when I Add/Delete include path entries blindly).

4.) The problem affects all projects in my workspace, and all new projects that I create in my workspace. I have also tried creating a new, empty workspace and the problem still occurs with all newly created C++ projects in the new, empty workspace.

5.) All other Path and symbols property pages work fine - it is only the Include tab that does not seem to work. I have tried tabbing back and forth to see if it was perhaps a repaint issue, but it does not seem to be (not do I believe that the backtrace suggests that it is).


Greg,

don't worry for Build ID: 
your Eclipse version is normal.
I'm sorry for my dumb question.

Really, I have no idea yet.

If official build contains so easy-reproducible problem,
there would be a lot of bugs created since its release.

On the other hand, I have no access to Win2000 now, so
testing cannot be made soon...

Anyway, when you'll reproduce this problem, please take
a look to .log file once more.

Thanks in advance.

Greg Bednarek
Created an attachment (id=77719)
Result of Eclipse execution with modified Eclipse CDT UI plugin (Oleg Krasilnikov)

Adding Steve to the CC, since the stack trace looked like it might be a Table bug. (Note this is on win2k.)

It seems like mentioned exception cannot be a root cause.
Corresponding code (Table.releaseChildren()) is called
only while Property dialog closing, not while opening.

Of course, code looks like not safe, itemCount may not
be equal to items.length in some (very specific) case:

   int itemCount = OS.SendMessage (handle, OS.LVM_GETITEMCOUNT, 0, 0);
   ......... 
   for (int i=0; i<itemCount; i++) {
      TableItem item = items [i];
      if (item != null && !item.isDisposed ()) item.release (false);
   }

But this problem is not directly related to this bug, I think.

Sorry.
I cannot continue with this bug, 
because I have no access to Win2000,
and it seems like situation would
not change in nearest future.
